flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • Molex Micro Fit Female Pin
  • Molex Micro Fit 2 Pos Connector Housing
Tools
  • Crimp Tool
  • Wire stripper

parts.text: Molex Micro Fit 2 Pos Connector Housing

lines.text: Strip a small section of insulation from a ground wire and power wire, approximately 3 mm.
lines.text_raw: Strip a small section of insulation from a ground wire and power wire, approximately 3 mm.

steps.title: Crimp the pin on the wire.

lines.text: Crimp the end of the wire into the female pin. This can be done using a $15 set of crimpers (shown) or pliers.
lines.text_raw: Crimp the end of the wire into the female pin. This can be done using a $15 set of crimpers (shown) or pliers.

lines.text: Insert the crimped connector into the housing. Power (red) should be on top, nearest the clip, and ground (green) should be on the bottom.
lines.text_raw: Insert the crimped connector into the housing. Power (red) should be on top, nearest the clip, and ground (green) should be on the bottom.

lines.text: Crimp the other wire, and insert it into the housing.
lines.text_raw: Crimp the other wire, and insert it into the housing.

lines.text: Insert the connector into the power board. Again, power on top, ground on the bottom.
lines.text_raw: Insert the connector into the power board. Again, power on top, ground on the bottom.

guide.summary: This tutorial will walk through crimping the connectors necessary to connect your own devices to the TurtleBot Power Board.
guide.title: Create Cables for the TurtleBot Power Board
